name: Farias Narrows
description:
Known as Brazil's version of the Zion Narrows. While the walls of Farias Narrows don't reach up thousands of feet, they do rise hundreds of feet , perhaps 500 feet high, and create a very dark and deep canyon. A great place to explore on a hot sticky day in the jungle. Can be combined with Capetinga to do on the same day.

Approach

Descent

R1: DCL to avoid logjam in flow. R2: jump, 4m. R3: traverse out on wide lid then down rabbit hole, stunning. R4: nice short one into 200â€™ long pool and the start of the narrows. Walk out into open creek, recommend exit left. Final two rappels require heinous steep climb around and additional hiking on an already long exit

Exit

After the final rappel you are likely encounter hikers hiking up from the bottom.
